review_title: TOWER HEALTH AT HOME  Lack of Team Players
pros: You can spend more one to one time with patients if you don't mind working 10-12hrs/day. Even feeling exhausted and having little time left for family, there is gratitude in teaching and providing comfort and understanding to patients and families.  I guess the fact that the nurses who were to orient in the field send new nurses home at or before noon to study orientation book so as not to interfere with their plans could be a pro. But difficult to learn a new computer system that way.
cons: Extreme amount of tension within the hospice team particularly the nurses. No hospice leadership. New nurses get dumped on as far as assignments regardless of tasks or geographic location. Patients who live in the outskirts of the county are not able to receive visits as frequently as those who are clustered in a particular geographic area. Even though false documentation signatures and time entries all make the surveyors happy it's detrimental to patient care and standards of nursing practice.  Was given false information at time of hire as far as working territory and hours to be assigned.

pros: You work with a lot of amazing people, it is always busy and rapidly growing, you gain a lot of valuable experience, benefits are great.
cons:
Communication is not transparent, staff is overloaded with work but not given the time to delegate it to other people who have the skills and time to take on more. 

Employees are unhappy - due to COVID, there were layoffs, wage cuts, etc. but they are still hiring in those same or similar positions AND offering signing bonuses. C-Suite leadership did nothing to reduce the burden of layoffs such as taking their own small wage cuts (a customary practice in many places when businesses need to cut costs) to save the jobs of others but had no problem cutting doctors pay.

job_title: Business Systems Analyst in Reading, PA
pros: Tower Health is continuously growing and providing some great value to the communities it serves. The organization really emphasizes the importance of delivering great health care to its patients while keeping cost affordable.  Its a mission that all employees can really take pride in. I am fortunate to be part of the Supply Chain (purchasing) department which has an innovative leadership team equipped with great vision who challenges their employees to think outside the box to deliver solutions that support the organization's mission.  Its rare to find such a great team of people in a company that allows for growth and continuous improvement while providing great benefits and compensation plan.
cons: Some cons include limited paid holidays, limited ability to work from home, and needing to park off site with limited access to your car during the work day. However these cons are more specific to the industry and in my opinion the pros outweigh the cons here at Tower Health.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Reading, PA
pros: Interacting with patients for as long as I did has made me a better, more caring, understanding person and listener.
cons: The management in Centran was despicable. Completely unwilling to work with people who are looking to better their lives and actively interfere with their schedules.  Favored "lifer" employees and shunned those looking to build their career and educational opportunities in order to have better lives.

review_title: Nice Facility With Good People but Patients are Never Assigned to the Right Rooms
pros: They have state of the art equipment. Good people.
cons: Patient treatment quality would be much higher if they assigned patientsto the correct rooms to ensure teams with the optimized skill set, which they do not. Ortho patients go to stroke rooms and stroke patients go to Ortho rooms.
